citation.article-title: Identification of bacterial isolates from biofilters as Paracoccus alkenifer sp. nov. and Paracoccus solventivorans with emended description of Paracoccus solventivorans.

p.s: Emended description of Paracoccus solventivorans (Siller, Rainey, Stackebrandt and Winter 1996)
Paracoccus solventivorans (sol.ven.ti.vo'rans. M. L. neut. n. solventum solvent; L. part. pres. vorans eating, devouring; M.L. solventivorans solvent-eating)
Cells are coccoid or rodlike, 0.4-0.5 x 0.9-1.5 μm, non-spore forming and nonmotile.
Optimum growth temperature is 30-37°C, optimum pH is 7-8.
Electron acceptors are oxygen and nitrate.
N2 is produced from nitrate via respiration.
Acetone is oxidized to CO2 and metabolized to polyhydroxybutyrate.

In addition, 2-butanone, 2-propanol, fumarate, succinate, gluconate, glutamate, aspartate, asparagine, α-ketoglutarate, isoleucine, glycine, ribose, propionate, n-butyrate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, acetoacetate, Casamino acids, gluconate, pyruvate and methylamine can serve as carbon sources.
Characteristic fatty acids are 12:1cis5 and 20:1cis13; 14:1cis7, 16:0 and 19:0cyclo11-12 are absent.
G+C content of DNA is 68.5 mol% (determined by HPLC) or 70 mol% (determined by Tm).
The species is a member of the α-3 subclass of the Proteobacteria.
